docs.snippet: U.S. Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump will propose allowing parents to deduct spending on childcare from their income taxes in a speech on Monday meant to challenge the economic policies of Democratic rival Hillary Clinton, a campaign ...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump will propose allowing parents to deduct spending on childcare from their income taxes in a speech on Monday meant to challenge the economic policies of Democratic rival Hillary Clinton, a campaign aide said.

headline.main: Trump to Propose Deduction on Childcare Spending: Aide
headline.print_headline: Trump to Propose Deduction on Childcare Spending: Aide

docs.snippet: Donald Trump is trying to shift from a disastrous stretch of his presidential campaign to one focused on policy and party unity. But even as his allies speak of lessons the political newcomer has learned, two of his staunchest Republican critics w...
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump is trying to shift from a disastrous stretch of his presidential campaign to one focused on policy and party unity. But even as his allies speak of lessons the political newcomer has learned, two of his staunchest Republican critics warn that he could be heading for losses in a pair of battleground states.

headline.main: Trump to Try to Steady Campaign With Economic Speech
headline.print_headline: Trump to Try to Steady Campaign With Economic Speech

docs.snippet: Representative Scott Rigell, a Republican who opposes Donald J. Trump, is the first member of Congress to throw his support to Gary Johnson....
docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Scott Rigell, a Republican who opposes Donald J. Trump, is the first member of Congress to throw his support to Gary Johnson.

headline.main: Congressman Backs Libertarian Presidential Candidate in Campaign First

docs.snippet: As secretary of state, Hillary Clinton basked in a diplomatic "Moscow Spring," seizing on Vladimir Putin's break from the presidency to help seal a nuclear arms-control treaty and secure Russia's acquiescence to a NATO-led military intervention in...
docs.lead_paragraph: As secretary of state, Hillary Clinton basked in a diplomatic "Moscow Spring," seizing on Vladimir Putin's break from the presidency to help seal a nuclear arms-control treaty and secure Russia's acquiescence to a NATO-led military intervention in Libya. When Putin returned to the top job, things changed.

headline.main: Clinton's 'Moscow Spring' Ended as Putin Returned to Power
headline.print_headline: Clinton's 'Moscow Spring' Ended as Putin Returned to Power

docs.snippet: The party, which held its convention on Saturday in Houston, has a new sense of vitality as its candidate, Jill Stein, draws about 5 percent in polls....
docs.lead_paragraph: The party, which held its convention on Saturday in Houston, has a new sense of vitality as its candidate, Jill Stein, draws about 5 percent in polls.
docs.abstract: Green Party and their presidential candidate Jill Stein see opportunity to push forward progressive agenda during campaign marked by voter discontent with establishment parties; party also looks to attract Bernie Sanders supporters in hopes of securing enough support to guarantee ballot access in future campaigns.

headline.main: Green Party Sees Opportunity Amid Wide Voter Discontent
headline.print_headline: Greens See Opportunity  Amid Voter Discontent

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Green Party of the United States

docs.snippet: Iran executed a nuclear scientist convicted of spying for the United States, an official said Sunday, acknowledging for the first time that the nation secretly detained and tried a man who was once heralded as a hero....
docs.lead_paragraph: Iran executed a nuclear scientist convicted of spying for the United States, an official said Sunday, acknowledging for the first time that the nation secretly detained and tried a man who was once heralded as a hero.

headline.main: Iran Executes Nuclear Scientist Who Was Convicted of Spying
headline.print_headline: Iran Executes Nuclear Scientist Who Was Convicted of Spying
